pros: Energetic and responsive ride; Grippy on light mud, dry rocks & loose trails; Protective cushion; Amazing heel hold; Upper doesn't need break-in; Airy even during hot days; Cheaper price; Stunning looks
cons: Poor grip on wet surfaces; Might hurt feet on hard surfaces
RR_verdict: The Nike Zoom Terra Kiger 8 remains the brand's staple lightweight and nimble trail running shoe fit for mid to high-mileage runs. It offers a protective and responsive ride that we find perfect for moderate to fast paces on almost all trail surfaces. Overall, if you want to up your speed may it be on training or race days, we believe that the Terra Kiger 8 will deliver without fail.
